ticTacToe

Class ValueIterationAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ticTacToe.Agent
      • ticTacToe.ValueIterationAgent

  • public class ValueIterationAgent
extends Agent
    A Value Iteration Agent, only very partially implemented. The methods to implement are: (1) iterate() (2) extractPolicy() You may also want/need to edit train() - feel free to do this, but you probably won't need to.
    Author:
    ae187

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ValueIterationAgent()
      This constructor trains the agent offline first and sets its policy

      ValueIterationAgent(Policy p)
      Use this constructor to initialise your agent with an existing policy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Policy extractPolicy()
      This method should be run AFTER the train method to extract a policy according to valueFunction You will need to do a single step of expectimax from each game (state) key in valueFunction to extract a policy.
      void initValues()
      Initialises the valueFunction map, and sets the initial value of all states to 0 (V0 from the lectures).
      void iterate()
      /* Performs k value iteration steps.
      void train()
      This method solves the mdp using your implementation of extractPolicy() and iterate().

    • Method Detail

      • initValues

        public void initValues()
        Initialises the valueFunction map, and sets the initial value of all states to 0 (V0 from the lectures). Uses Game.inverseHash(int) and Game.generateAllValidGames(char) to do this.

      • iterate

        public void iterate()
        /* Performs k value iteration steps. After running this method, the valueFunction map should contain the (current) values of each reachable state. You should use the TTTMDP provided to do this.

      • extractPolicy

        public Policy extractPolicy()
        This method should be run AFTER the train method to extract a policy according to valueFunction You will need to do a single step of expectimax from each game (state) key in valueFunction to extract a policy.
        Returns:
        the policy according to valueFunction

      • train

        public void train()
        This method solves the mdp using your implementation of extractPolicy() and iterate().
